meanings.definition: A slight or invisible exhalation or vapor, especially one that is disagreeable or noxious.
meanings.sent1: The effluvia from the garbage can made the room smell bad.
meanings.sent2: The effluvia of the factory polluted the air in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The effluvia from the skunk was so strong that even the birds flew away.
meanings.sent4: The effluvia of negativity in the room was suffocating.
meanings.sent5: The effluvia of fear lingered in the dark alley, making it eerie.

meanings.definition: Waste or byproduct, especially in the form of liquid or gas.
meanings.sent1: The effluvia from the chemical plant contaminated the river.
meanings.sent2: The effluvia of the sewage system was causing environmental issues.
meanings.sent3: The effluvia from the kitchen sink seemed to have a life of its own.
meanings.sent4: The effluvia of lost opportunities filled his mind with regret.
meanings.sent5: The effluvia of betrayal hung heavy in the air between them.
